programme.desc: Penniless Irish farmer Joseph seeks revenge on the cruel landowner who drove him from his home. However, the landlord's daughter, desperate to escape her family, persuades him to join her in seeking their fortune in America. The pair plan to stake a claim in the Oklahoma gold rush, but instead Joseph is forced to become a bare-knuckle fighter to support them. Romantic drama set in the 1890s, starring Tom Cruise, Nicole Kidman and Thomas Gibson.(n)

programme.title: The Young Messiah
programme.desc: Biblical drama telling the story of Jesus Christ at the age of seven as he and his family depart Egypt to return home to Nazareth and the youngster begins to discover the true extent of his gifts. Adam Greaves-Neal stars, with Sara Lazzaro, Christian McKay and Sean Bean.(n)

programme.title: A Star Is Born
programme.desc: Following a gig, fading music star Jackson Maine happens upon Ally, a nightclub singer-songwriter. Their instant chemistry leads to a tempestuous romance as he helps her on the road to stardom. However, Jackson's alcoholism has explosive repercussions as her career blossoms. Oscar-winning drama, starring Lady Gaga, Bradley Cooper, who also directed, and Sam Elliott.(n)

programme.title: Widow Clicquot
programme.desc: In the late 18th century, a group of women create the Veuve Clicquot champagne business. Drama, starring Haley Bennett, Tom Sturridge and Sam Riley.(n)

programme.title: Bonus Track
programme.desc: An aspiring teenage musician teams up with the son of a rock star to try and win the school talent show. Comedy, starring Joe Anders, Samuel Small and Susan Wokoma.(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Artist Gerda Wegener unveils a portrait of her husband Einar dressed as a woman in 1920s Copenhagen. Einar realises that the woman in the painting is his true identity, and decides to become one of the first people to undergo sex reassignment surgery. Period drama based on David Ebershoff's novel inspired by the true story of artist Lili Elbe, starring Eddie Redmayne and an Oscar-winning Alicia Vikander.(n)

programme.title: Parachute
programme.desc: Riley, a young woman recently released from rehab, meets Ethan and finds herself navigating the line between love and a new addiction. Director Brittany Snow's romantic comedy drama, starring Courtney Eaton, Thomas Mann and Dave Bautista.(n)

programme.title: The Breakfast Club
programme.desc: Five teenagers who occupy different areas of their school's social structure are thrown together for a Saturday morning detention. During the day, they analyse their behaviour and find unexpected common ground. Drama, directed by John Hughes and starring Emilio Estevez, Judd Nelson, Molly Ringwald, Anthony Michael Hall, Ally Sheedy and Paul Gleason.(n)

programme.title: The Young Messiah
programme.desc: Biblical drama telling the story of Jesus Christ at the age of seven as he and his family depart Egypt to return home to Nazareth and the youngster begins to discover the true extent of his gifts. Adam Greaves-Neal stars, with Sara Lazzaro, Christian McKay and Sean Bean.(n)

programme.title: Out of Africa
programme.desc: Fact-based romantic drama based on the life of writer Karen Blixen, who, after relocating from Denmark to a farm in Nairobi for a marriage of convenience, embarked on a passionate and ill-fated love affair with an idealistic British adventurer. Starring Meryl Streep, Robert Redford, Michael Kitchen, Klaus Maria Brandauer and Leslie Phillips.(n)

programme.title: A Good Person
programme.desc: Allison is a young woman whose world falls apart when she survives an unimaginable tragedy. While in recovery for an opioid addiction and unresolved grief, she forms an unlikely friendship with her would-be father-in-law, Daniel, that gives her a fighting chance to put her life back together. Writer/director Zach Braff's drama, starring Florence Pugh and Morgan Freeman.(n)

programme.title: Sneaks
programme.desc: Ty is a designer trainer who lives a life of luxury and comfort. However, when a shady shoe collector steals his sister, Ty, is forced to venture out into the world, and onto the streets of New York, to rescue her. Animated comedy, with the voices of Anthony Mackie, Keith David and Laurence Fishburne.(n)

programme.title: Touch
programme.desc: A man embarks on an emotional journey to find his first love who disappeared 50 years ago. Icelandic romantic drama, starring Egill Olafsson, Koki and Palmi Kormakur. In English, Japanese and Icelandic.(n)

programme.title: The Parenting
programme.desc: A couple rent a countryside house for a weekend with their parents, but their break is ruined when they discover it's inhabited by a 400-year-old poltergeist. Horror comedy, starring Nik Dodani, Brandon Flynn and Brian Cox.(n)

programme.title: Greedy People
programme.desc: A rookie cop is partnered with an unhinged and morally dubious local officer in a small island town. A murder and the discovery of a million dollars soon turns the local community's lives upside down. Director Potsy Ponciroli's comedy, starring Himesh Patel, Lily James and Joseph Gordon-Levitt.(n)

programme.title: A Quiet Place
programme.desc: Horror thriller starring Emily Blunt and John Krasinski. After blind insectoid monsters with super-sensitive hearing wipe out most of humanity, a family of survivors adapts to living in silence. But with a new baby on the way, their noiseless way of life is about to become a lot more difficult...

programme.title: A Quiet Place: Day One
programme.desc: Sci-fi horror prequel starring Lupita Nyong'o and Joseph Quinn. New York City is suddenly attacked by terrifying alien creatures with super-sensitive hearing. Sam, a terminally ill cancer patient, and law student Eric are among those who have survived the initial assault - but how long can they remain alive when the faintest noise can be deadly?

programme.title: Ordinary Angels
programme.desc: Drama based on a true story, starring Hilary Swank and Alan Ritchson. A struggling hairdresser in small-town Kentucky finds purpose by putting her energies into helping a widowed father get the funds to provide a liver transplant for his youngest daughter.

programme.title: Hounds of War
programme.desc: After a mission goes wrong, one of a group of mercenaries is left alive to take revenge for his colleagues. Director Isaac Florentine's action thriller, starring Frank Grillo, Rhona Mitra and Robert Patrick.

programme.desc: Not sure what to watch next? Then discover some of the greatest British Sky Originals. From Four Kids and It to SAS Red Notice, there's something here for everyone.

programme.title: The Secret Kingdom
programme.desc: Peter and his younger sister Verity move into a new house and struggle to acclimatise to their surroundings in an emotionally unsettling period for their family. The children tumble into a cavernous space beneath their bedroom and are greeted by an army of pangolins, who decree Peter their ruler. Fantasy adventure, starring Sam Everingham and Alyla Browne.

programme.title: Black Dog
programme.desc: Road movie starring Jamie Flatters and Keenan Munn-Francis. Outgoing London teen Nathan stumbles across his shy school friend Sam being mugged and leaps in to save him. Discovering that they are both planning to travel north, Sam offers Nathan a seat in his car.

programme.title: The Killer
programme.desc: An assassin tries to make amends in an attempt to restore the sight of a beautiful young singer. Director/Producer John Woo's remake of his namesake 1989 thriller, starring Nathalie Emmanuel, Omar Sy and Sam Worthington.

programme.title: The Three Musketeers: Milady
programme.desc: Swashbuckling historical adventure sequel starring FranÃ§ois Civil, Vincent Cassel and Eva Green. Meanwhile, Porthos, Aramis and Athos are on their own mission...

programme.title: Goodrich
programme.desc: Andy's life gets upended when his wife enters a 90-day rehab program, leaving him in charge of their twins. With his career falling by the wayside, he soon leans on his pregnant daughter for support, ultimately becoming the father she never had.

programme.title: The Last of Us
programme.desc: Joel and Ellie must survive ruthless killers and monsters on a trek across America after an outbreak.

programme.title: The Dark Money Game
programme.desc: When a political lobbyist is found shot to death, his apparent suicide highlights a bizarre turn in Ohio's largest public corruption case, uncovered by federal investigators that was nearly concealed by loose super PAC campaign financing rules.

programme.title: The Dark Money Game
programme.desc: Tracing the tangled history of campaign finance back to the creation of the Federal Election Commission (FEC) in 1975, the 2002 McCain-Feingold Campaign Finance Reform Bill, and the Citizens United decision of 2010.

programme.title: The Righteous Gemstones
programme.desc: Following three generations of a famous televangelist family with a tradition of charitable work, deviance and greed.

programme.title: Black Death
programme.desc: A monk investigates rumors of people being resurrected during an outbreak of the bubonic plague.

programme.desc: Filmmakers Albert Maysles, David Maysles and Charlotte Zwerin show the Rolling Stones' 1969 California concert.

programme.title: Eyes on the Prize III
programme.desc: Amid a growing environmental justice movement, communities in West Virginia and Florida fight threats to their health and survival.

programme.title: Drinking Buddies
programme.desc: Although they're both dating other people, two co-workers (Olivia Wilde, Jake Johnson) hang out together in bars and try to ignore their mutual attraction.

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: A human soldier is sent from 2029 to 1984 to stop a cyborg killing machine, which has been programmed to execute a young woman whose unborn son is the key to humanity's future salvation.

programme.desc: A SWAT team ace (Keanu Reeves) must keep the speed of a Santa Monica bus above 50 mph, or a madman's (Dennis Hopper) bomb will explode.

programme.title: We're Here
programme.desc: After a successful open drag show Sasha, Priyanka and Jaida begin planning an even larger event; Priyanka welcomes her first drag daughter; the queens risk getting arrested for attending a town hall meeting in full drag attire.

programme.title: We're Here
programme.desc: The queens refocus their efforts after a worse-than-expected town hall meeting and hope the local community shows up for their kids.

programme.title: We're Here
programme.desc: The Queens travel to conservative Oklahoma, a state that has introduced an alarming number of anti-LGBTQ+ bills, to work with attack survivor Christian, proud father and viral sensation Kris, and more.

programme.title: We're Here

programme.title: We're Here
programme.desc: As the crowd for their park gathering grows, the Queens vow to meet the hate with even louder outpourings of love; after finally securing an unconventional venue, Sasha, Priyanka, and Latrice, prepare for an epic drag show of biblical proportions.

programme.desc: When a deadly zombie virus sweeps the nation, a father stops at nothing to save his infected daughter.

programme.title: Friday After Next
programme.desc: Working as security guards, Craig (Ice Cube) and Day-Day (Mike Epps) run into the thief who stole their Christmas presents.

programme.title: The Usual Suspects
programme.desc: A detective (Chazz Palminteri) questions a con man about his relationships with assorted criminals (Stephen Baldwin, Gabriel Byrne) and their link to a ship explosion.

programme.title: Bad Santa
programme.desc: Two criminals (Billy Bob Thornton, Tony Cox) disguise themselves as St. Nick and an elf to rob stores at Christmastime.

programme.title: Aftersun
programme.desc: Years after their last vacation, Sophie reflects on the rare time spent with her loving, idealistic father, attempting to reconcile the father she knew with the man she didn't.

programme.title: Reality
programme.desc: A former American intelligence specialist is given the longest sentence for the unauthorized release of government information to the media about Russian interference in the 2016 United States elections via an email operation.

programme.title: Ninja Assassin
programme.desc: A rogue (Rain) enlists the help of the Europol agent (Naomie Harris) whose life he saved to bring down the clan of hired killers who trained him as an assassin.
